page.title: 13A FIRE IN CRICKLEWOOD
page.content:
On Friday 24th August 1984 there was one of the biggest fires for ten years in London. The fire started at about 5.00pm at the{Cricklewood Trading {Estate.}The fire could be seen about ten miles away. At the scene of the fire there was a crowd of people, some of them were taking pictures of it. There were lots of fire engines, firemen, police cars and policemen. The firemen were working to keep the fire under control for about seven to eight hours. Lots of people had to be evacuated from their houses. Several million pounds worth of damage was done in the fire. The public still do not know how it started.
by {Paolo Velicaz}
